com.xd.cps2002.map

Class MapCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.map.MapCreator

  • public class MapCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    The MapCreator class is used to create different types of Map objects. This class is the "creator" class used to implement the static factory design pattern. Using the static factory design pattern, the creation process of different types of maps is abstracted away from other classes. Hence, this allows the code to support new map types without necessarily needing to change the code where the Map sub-class is instantiated. Moreover, since the factory method used to create Map instances is static, the function can also simultaneously restrict the number of map instances that can be created to a single instance. In effect, the class also acts similar to a singleton, and creates and stores a Map object which is referred to throughout the runtime of the program. The advantage of including the logic to limit the creation of new instances in the MapCreator rather than Map is two-fold. First of all, the functionality to implement this restriction is only implemented once rather than having to implement it for each and every concrete instance of the Map class. Secondly, since the Map subclasses do not need to be singletons, they also become far more easy to test as a result. To only allow the MapCreator class to initialize concrete implementations of the Map class, the subclasses' constructors need to have protected rather private access modifiers. However, this access modifier is still flexible enough to allows unit tests in the same package as the classes to reinitialize Map instances between unit tests.

    • Method Detail

      • createMap

        public static Map createMap(java.lang.String mapType,
                            int size)
        Factory method used to create different types of Map objects. Depending on the string passed to the mapType parameter, the method can return the following map types:
        • "safe" - creates a map where 0-10% of the tiles are water tiles, and the player can start playing from at least 75% of the tiles
        • "hazardous" - creates a map where 25-35% of the tiles are water tiles, and the player can start playing from at least 60% of the tiles
        Parameters:
        mapType - A string representing the type of map to be created.
        size - size of the map to be created.
        Returns:
        A Map object with the type represented by mapType
        API Note:
        This method creates a new Map instance only the first time it is called. This means that the method is guaranteed to return a map of the requested type only the first time it is called.

      • createMap

        public static Map createMap(java.lang.String mapType,
                            TileType[][] tiles)
        Factory method used to create different types of Map objects with a preset set of tiles (for testing). Depending on the string passed to the mapType parameter, the method can return the following map types:
        • "basic" - creates a BasicMap object.
        Parameters:
        mapType - A string representing the type of map to be created.
        tiles - a 2D array of TileType elements which represents the placement of the tiles in the map
        Returns:
        A Map object with the type represented by mapType
        API Note:
        This method creates a new Map instance only the first time it is called. This means that the method is guaranteed to return a map of the requested type only the first time it is called.
        Implementation Note:
        Since this method does not randomly generate the map tiles, it could not be made to return "safe" and "hazardous" map types. Hence, it only returns the "basic" map type.
